Description:
INITIAL DISTRIBUTION OF BFY 2022-2023 ISEP FUNDS BASED ON 80 PERCENT OF THE SY 2021-2022 FINAL DISTRIBUTION OF $3,795,900. THE DISTRIBUTION OF SY 2022- 2023 INDIAN SCHOOL EQUALIZATION PROGRAM (ISEP) FUNDS IS ALLOCATED BASED UPON (1) 25 CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATION (25 CFR) PART 39 ?SUBPART B: INDIAN SCHOOL EQUALIZATION FORMULA; AND (2) INCLUSION OF ANNUAL FIXED COSTS FUNDING FOR BIE FUNDED SCHOOLS TEACHER AND COUNSELOR PAY RAISES IN PARITY WITH DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE (DOD) PAY RATES IN ACCORDANCE WITH CONGRESSIONAL DIRECTION IN HOUSE REPORT 116-448 ACCOMPANYING PUBLIC LAW 116-260, THE 2021 CONSOLIDATED APPROPRIATIONS BILL. CFDA#15.042

INITIAL DISTRIBUTION OF BFY 2022-2023 TRANSPORTATION FUNDS BASED ON 80 PERCENT OF THE SY 2021-2022 FINAL DISTRIBUTION OF $682,927. CFDA#15.044.

INITIAL DISTRIBUTION OF BFY 2022-2023 TRIBAL GRANT SUPPORT COST FUNDS BASED ON 80 PERCENT OF THE SY 2021-2022 FINAL DISTRIBUTION OF $1,014,800. CFDA#15.046.

DISTRIBUTION OF BFY 2022-2023 ISEP CONTINGENCY FUNDS IS BASED UPON RELEASE OF A 1 PERCENT RESERVED AMOUNT ON 1 JULY 2022. RELEASE OF THE RESERVED CONTINGENCY FUNDS IS BASED UPON HISTORICAL CONTINGENCY FUND USAGE AND HISTORICALLY EXCESS CONTINGENCY FUNDS AVAILABLE. THE METHODOLOGY USED IN THE DISTRIBUTION OF BFY 2022-2023 CONTINGENCY FUNDS TO BIE-FUNDED SCHOOLS IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH 25 CFR, PART 39. CFDA#15.042.

DISTRIBUTION OF BFY 2022-2023 ISEP PROGRAM ADJUSTMENT ? FOCUS SCHOOLS ARE TO PROVIDE AND RESPOND TO SPECIFIC FINDINGS OF NEEDS OR DEFICIENCIES FOR SOUND ACADEMIC PRINCIPLES AND METHODOLOGIES THAT HAVE PROMISE OF IMPROVING STUDENT PERFORMANCE, WELL-BEING AND A SAFE SCHOOL ENVIRONMENT TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO STUDENTS. CFDA#15.149.
